Author:

  • Name: Fabrice Bellard
    Location: FR - French Republic (France)

To build:

make

To use:

./bellard

Judges’ remarks:

This code is a nice compact example of a Modular Fast Fourier Transform. While its output is very specific, the internal FFT has a wide variety of uses.

Can you modify this code to produce primes such as 23523*2^70000-1, 48594^65536+1 or 6917!-1?

NOTE: as bigger primes are found as time goes by this program no longer prints the biggest prime once noted by the author below.

Author’s comments:

This program prints the biggest known prime number (2^6972593-1) in base 10. It requires a few minutes. It uses a Modular Fast Fourier Transform to compute this number in a reasonable amount of time (the usual method would take ages !).

The program uses >= 64 bit long long type. It should run on any system with a gcc compiler.
